qas.question: What region is home to the gorillas studied by the Wildlife Conservation Society?
What was responsible for maintaining the separation between the gorillas and humans?
When did researchers from the Wildlife Conservation Society study chimps?
Where did researchers study chimps in heavily forested regions?
How many chimpanzees live in the area?
What has kept the chimps isolated from humans?
In what kind of regions did researchers not find any gorillas?

context: In <b3_0>2006–07<b3_0/>, researchers from the <a0_0>Wildlife Conservation Society<a0_0/> studied gorillas in <b7_0>heavily forested<b7_0/> regions centered on the <b4_0>Ouesso district<b4_0/> of the <a1_0>Sangha Region<a1_0/>. They suggest a population on the order of <b5_0>125,000<b5_0/> Western Lowland Gorillas, whose isolation from humans has been largely preserved by <a2_0><b6_0>inhospitable swamps<b6_0/><a2_0/>.
